channel.title: Yangpyeong-gun on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: A gourmet trip to a small town in Yangpyeong - Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
Yangpyeong Terra Rosa finished with red brick and white walls

A gourmet trip to a small town in Yangpyeong

Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

When you exit Seojong IC, you will see a village called Munho-ri, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, located along the Bukhan River. At first glance, it doesn't look much different from the surrounding area, but if you look closely, there are treasure-like spaces hidden everywhere. That's why Moon Ho-ri is also called “Hot Place” that emerges from Yangpyeong. There are natural yeast bakeries and Japanese kaiseki cuisine shops that seem to fit into downtown Seoul, and Terrarosa in Gangneung, which is famous for word of mouth nationwide, has also opened in this neighborhood.

Coffee meeting with Nordic Cultural Center, Terra Rosa, Yangpyeong
Terrarosa opened in a different atmosphere from Terrarosa Coffee Factory in Gangneung, Munho-ri, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong.
The building exterior with red brick and white walls is impressive.
Yangpyeong Terra Rosa finished with red brick and white walls
You can taste coffee and bread with the same flavor as you had in Gangneung, and the North European Cultural Center is located on the second floor, making it even more special.
A complex cultural ball where you can experience Nordic culture and design together
Most recognize this place simply as Terra Rosa, but there are several spaces in it.
Inside Yangpyeong Terra Rosa
It is a factory-type complex cultural space where the Nordic Cultural Center aiming to serve as a platform for Nordic culture and Nordic Design Gallery co-exist Vint.
Inside Yangpyeong Terra Rosa
The small garden overlooking through the large front window and the Nordic culture felt everywhere makes a sip of coffee here more special.
We sell coffee and various breads
Ginsburg, honest bread taste without greed
Even in Yangpyeong, it was purely this small bakery that first turned to Munjong-ri, Seojong-myeon. Ginsburg's unique bakery. The words 'no butter, no milk, no sugar' on the signboard caught my eye. When you visit Ginsburg on the morning of the weekend, you will often encounter the scenery where residents of Munho-ri come together to enjoy a cup of coffee with delicious bread. In Munho-ri, where many “semi-urbans” want to enjoy their rural life while commuting to Seoul, Ginsburg is playing a role in the neighborhood love room. On the morning of the weekend, people and locals who come to taste the bread in the countryside mix variously in this small bakery.
Ginsberg sells healthy bread in small portions a day
Ginsberg sells healthy bread in small portions a day
The history of a young male boss, who worked as a marketer in Tokyo, Japan, entered a small town in Yangpyeong and produced a natural yeast bakery, is unique. Because only a few kinds of bread are baked in small portions a day, it is easy to stir up a little late on the weekends. Some people have tried 3 or 4 or 7 to eat Ginsburg's bread. President Ginsburg, who uses natural yeast instead of yeast to make only a fixed amount per day, seems greedy. We open the store door only five days a week (Wednesday to Sunday) and close it early if the bread is sold out. Where is that? In the winter, he dares to close the door for a month or two and then travels. It is closed this year from the end of January to February 28th. So if you want to visit Ginsburg, you have to wait until March 1st.
Healthy and savory Ginsberg bread
Square sky, a house that restores the happiness of a relaxing meal
Ginsburg's owner recommends 'Square Sky', saying, “There is a place in this neighborhood where the taste of udon is amazing.” A little uphill from the Bukhangangro running along the river leads to a square sky in a quiet space.
There is a square sky that is perfect for the name of the store.
It has already been in place for over 10 years, but it hasn't had a booming reputation. Still, people come from mouth to mouth by knowing.
An attractive space that looks like a combination of Korean and Japanese architectural beauty

Run by a Japanese architect's husband and a Korean wife, Square Sky is an authentic Japanese Kaiseki cuisine restaurant.

An attractive space that looks like a combination of Korean and Japanese architectural beauty
Because it is operated by reservation system, there are not many guests in the large space. When you walk on the floor, the creak sounds calm and peaceful enough to fill your ears. You can never find the hustle and bustle of a typical restaurant.
An attractive space that looks like a combination of Korean and Japanese architectural beauty
It is an atmosphere where you can focus on the food in front of you and the person who is with you. Let's fully enjoy the pleasure of a laid-back meal that was not enjoyed in a busy daily life.
An attractive space that looks like a combination of Korean and Japanese architectural beauty
Although it is a Japanese restaurant specializing in Kaiseki cuisine, it is usually eaten with a lot of sukiyaki (Japanese dishes similar to shabu shabu) and udon set meals.
An attractive space that looks like a combination of Korean and Japanese architectural beauty
The price is high, but if you look at the enthusiasm that goes into food one by one, most of them don't cost much.
Clean and tasty food in the sky
In the case of sukiyaki, some people are somewhat uncomfortable because they cook all the food on their side. But let's understand that it is the owner's sincerity to take care of the food so that customers can eat the food as deliciously as possible.
Clean and tasty food in the sky
The udon set meal is usually not a udon with soup, but a soy sauce. The chewy texture is attractive.
Clean and tasty food in the sky
A peaceful space away from everyday life is more than enough for a delicious meal.
Udon soaked in sauce
A bowl of simple red bean porridge warmth, red bean porridge
When you run on the North Korean road in Munho-ri, you will see the sign “Munho-ri Red Bean Porridge”. This is a place where the taste of red bean porridge that floats in the eggs is excellent.
Moonho red bean porridge scenery
It is not thick and sweet red bean porridge. You can enjoy the taste of the real red bean porridge boiled with only red beans without starch.
Moonho red bean porridge scenery
Since it uses only domestic red beans and is made without liver, the original taste of red beans is felt. Salt and sugar are prepared separately, so you can control the liver according to your taste.
Red bean porridge
In addition to red bean porridge, you can also taste Jeolla-do red bean kalguksu, perilla sujebi, and ulken kalguksu. A bowl of red bean porridge boiled for a long time will warm the inside.
Cool taste of Ulken Kalguksu
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Olympic Boulevard → Seoul Chuncheon Expressway → Turn left at ‘Yangpyeong, Seojong, Sonagi Village’ at Seojong IC Intersection → Moonho-ri

2. Restaurants around

Ginsburg: Bakery / 62 Munaemi-gil, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-771-8798

Square sky: Japanese home-style cuisine / 53, Gilgok 2-gil, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-774-3670

http://www.sagakhanul.com

Yangpyeong Terra Rosa: Cafe / 992 Bukhangang-ro, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-773-6966

http://www.terarosa.com/

Moonhori Red Bean Porridge: Red bean porridge / 888 Bukhangang-ro, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-774-5969

http://www.moonhori.com/

3.Accommodation

Hanok Village Loess Pension: 43-6, Jeonui 1-gil, Gangnam, Yangpyeong-gun / 010-9081-5411

http://www.hanok54.co.kr/

Yangpyeong Valley: 14 Baekan-gil 60beon-gil, Yangpyeong-eup, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-774-3000

http://www.yp-valley.co.kr/

Hyundai Bloom Vista: 316 Gangnam-ro, Ganghae-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-770-8888


※ The above information was created in February 2014, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Looking for the simple station of the old central line, from Yangpyeong Paldang Station to Ganhyeon Station - Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
Beautiful bicycle path running while looking at the lakeside of Paldang

Looking for the simple station of the old central line, from Yangpyeong Paldang Station to Ganhyeon Station

Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

More than 20 years ago, I thought of a trip on the Jungang Line Pigeon Lake from Cheongnyangni. When the train rattled past Deokso and Yangpyeong and ran with a slow, steady force in the direction of Wonju, I thought that I would like to have a little more than 10 days of enlistment while holding my chin on the window sill.

When you go to Gangwon-do or the East Coast, Guri and Namyangju are the places you can pass by. Nowadays, there are many new paths, so the route to Gangwon-do is diverse, but in the past, going to Chuncheon or Wonju had to go through the Donongsamgeori in front of the Namyangju Police Station.
Roadside barrier between Paldang and Neungnae
From here, heading towards Wonju, passing Deokso to Yangpyeong, ran along the Jungang Line railroad. Sometimes I ran side by side or crossed each other, and I met faces with passengers in a train. Such a central railroad track was transformed into a double track railroad track after several years of construction. As the new train line was laid, the fate of the old Jungang Line was mixed. After removing the railroad tracks, it became a bicycle path, or the use of it for rail bikes changed, or some sections disappeared. All that's left is to lose some railroad tracks and only a few simple stations.
Old Route 6 passing by the Paldang Dam
After passing Deokso and near Paldang Station, there are several bicycle rental shops along the road. In recent years, the vicinity of Paldang has emerged as a bicycle mecca. Although many bicycle paths have been opened along the river stalks across the country, there are few places that are as nice as the Paldang ~ Yangsuri ~ Yangpyeong section.
There are many bicycle rental shops on the roadside near Paldang Station.
The bicycle path along the site where the old railway line was removed is passed through the tunnel section of Yeraksan Mountain and looks out over the beautiful lakeside of Paldang. When the road reaches Joan-myeon, you will find Neungnae Station.
The place where the old railway line was removed was a bicycle path.
Neungnae Station opened in 1956 and was closed after the double-track electrification of the Jungang Line in 2008. However, it is fortunate that the old history has not been demolished and is decorated and preserved as a photo exhibition hall.
Neungnae History, opened in 1956, was closed in 2008.
When you enter the room, you can see faded photos hanging on the wall. There are also photos of the old look of Neungnae Station, middle-aged men and women in school uniforms, and bright smiles of attired couples.
Faded photos in Neungnae Station
School uniforms are also available so that visitors can borrow and leave photos. After pushing the gate that was the ticket gate, you can see the platform and railroad tracks where passengers were waiting for the train.
Neungnae Station Waiting Room Stove
There is a wooden stool on the platform. There are a few older women sitting there, funneling up and talking as if they were back in their high school days ago.
Story flowers
Unlike Neungnae Station, which has been preserved as it was in the past, all of the simple stations from Yangsuri to Yangpyeong have disappeared, and a modern history has been created.
Entrance to Neungnae Station overlooking the street
From Yongmun, get off the national road and enter the 341 local road. The area around Jipyeong-myeon, centered on Jipyeong Station, was where the United Nations and the People's Liberation Army of China fought fiercely during the Korean War. Since the winter of 1951, the Allied Forces, which have been pushed by the Chinese military offensive, hold a commemorative event every year in honor of their successful counterattack. However, the Jipyeong Station Square, where the event is held, has recently been newly constructed, making it difficult to find old traces.
Jipyeong Makgeolli
The following Seokbul Station is a simple station with only a palm. Although it is a newly built history, it is very small and looks different. Compared to the newly built stations from Ungilsan Station to Jipyeong Station, the squares and personalities of the new stations are as good as toys.
Seokbul Station on the newly established Jungang Line
I remember the placard I saw as I passed around a few years ago. There was the phrase 'opposite the demolition of Seokbul Station, which is the foot of the local people'. At that time, I passed by indifferently, but it was a serious issue for the local people. Thanks to that, even though it is small, a new Seokbul Station has been established.
The new Seokbul Station is small and cute like a toy.
The old Seokbul Station still remains nearby. After looking at the old history of removing the railroad tracks, I ran into the staff of Yangpyeong County Office. He also said that there are plans to preserve the old simple stations left in the hall and turn them into tourism resources. If you want to take a photo, Gudun Station beyond the hill is in good condition, so he tells you to go there.
The old Seokbul Station became a closed station and the railway was removed.
Gudun Station was recently designated as No. 296 by the Cultural Heritage Administration. This is due to the fact that it maintains the best shape among the simple stations in Yangpyeong to Wonju and has excellent views of the surroundings, and is recognized for its conservation value. Recently, as it became known as the filming location for the film <Introduction to Architecture>, more people were looking for it.
Gudun Station designated as No. 296 Modern Cultural Heritage
When you enter the waiting room, long chairs and timetables remain. When you open the gate of the ticket gate and go out to the platform, you can see red and rusty railroad tracks and carriages.
Train timetable that remains in the waiting room of Gudun Station
The juniper tree on the front side has the name 'wish tree'. Each visitor hung a note on each branch. However, the station yard is a cultural asset, and as a whole, it feels a bit bleak as if it was before full-scale maintenance. Still, the large ginkgo and wish trees are worth seeing, and the simple atmosphere of a simple station feels like a scene from a short film.
Wishing tree in front of the waiting room with the wishes of visitors
Maegok Station and Pandae Station also have a new history. The old Maegok Station has already removed the railroad tracks, and Pandae Station is still in its old form.
Maegok Station, destined to be demolished
In the flower bed in front of the closed waiting room, tall blue lilies bloomed amongst lush weeds. Even though the railroad tracks were red and rusty, it is still a scene where trains are likely to come in from the other side of the mountain.
Pandae Station
Pandae Station The next Ganhyeon Station belongs to Wonju-si, Gangwon-do. It is Seomgang that divides Gyeonggi-do and Gangwon-do between the two stations. The sign “Wonju Rail Park” is hanging at the entrance of Ganhyeon Station, which is located across the designated bridge over the island river. Ganhyeon Station looks compact and repainted like a simple station.
Ganhyeon Station was reborn as Wonju Rail Park.
The interior has been transformed into a rail bike ticketing counter, and rail bikes line the platform waiting for passengers. The 7km section between Ganhyeon Station and Pandae Station has 7 bridges and 6 tunnels that cross the island river and Samsancheon River, and the surrounding scenery is excellent, so it will be very popular in the future.
Rail bike running 7km

In an age where everything is changing rapidly, people have a breathtaking experience. Those who are tired of the speed need space to rest for a while. If you look for simple stations on the old Jungang Line, you can taste the warmth and the feeling of time slowly flowing.

Rail bike passing through the bridge over the island river
Travel information

Yangpyeong-gun homepage: www.yp21.net
Yangpyeong Rail Bike: 031, 775-9911, www.yprailbike.com
Wonju Rail Park: 033-733-6600, www.wjrailpark.com


1.Access

* Self-driving

Hanam City → Paldang Bridge → National Road No. 6 → Yangpyeong → Local Road No. 341 → Local Road No. 88

* public transport

From Yongsan Station or Cheongnyangni Station, take the Jungang Line


2. Restaurants around

Soybean Soybean Tofu: Organic Ssambap / 102 Yangsu-ro, Yangseo-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-773-6733

Okcheon Naengmyeon: Naengmyeon, Meatballs / 1493-8 Gyeonggang-ro, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-773-3575

3.Accommodation

Aehwa Dream Pension: 109, Deokchon-gil, Yongmun-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-771-6030

http://www.ypension.net/

Yangpyeong Women's Pension: 30-10, Sangwonsa-gil, Yongmun-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 010-3737-6820

http://www.yeoulps.com/

Yangpyeong birch: 1062-19 Bukhangang-ro, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 010-8957-0713

※ The above information was created in September 2013, and may change later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Filming location of “Gwansang”, famous mountain snow plum and ginkgo tree at Yongmunsa Temple - Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea
item.description:
The view from the front yard of Naekyung's house through the silver grass

Filming location of “Gwansang”, famous mountain snow plum and ginkgo tree at Yongmunsa Temple

Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea

Seolmaejae is the filming location for the movie <Kwannwan>, the best topic in the second half of 2013. It was a time when the family of Naekyung (Song Kang-ho) lived comfortably. Looking down from the silver grass hill in front of the house, the anxiety disappears. In the autumn outing, a nearby Yongmunsa Temple with 1,100-year-old ginkgo trees is also recommended. This is a temple that the Yangyang army in <Contemplative> visited twice before and after the Gyeyujeong.

Looking for a contemplative town in Chittaksan
It is November. The wind is quite cold along the Namhan River. Everywhere is uneven. It is late autumn. It's perfect because the pickling is in harmony. In particular, Yangpyeong is more busy in autumn because it has many famous mountains. Yumyeongsan Mountain, Yongmunsan Mountain, and Jungmisan Mountain show off slightly different charms. Then there are different statues on the mountain. Pungsu geography is a contemplation of nature.
A house of inner diameter located in the middle of a silver grass field
Not long ago, the movie <Contemplation> became popular. It was the tenth in the Korean film industry, attracting 9 million audiences. The actors' strong acting also stood out, but the material of ornamental was also a significant influence on the box office. <Contemplation> is set in the background of the sedation. This was the case when the Sooyang Grand Army removed Kim Jong-seo, etc., and took Danjong's throne. At the center of its history, the ornamental contest follows Kim Nae-kyung's gaze.
Autumn scenery along the road to the location where <Swanaejae>
The first scene is the path that Gisaeng Yeon-hong (Hye-soo Kim) visits the inner diameter. The inner diameter lives like a Moorim coriander hiding in the middle of the night. There may be a factor called the family of a rebellious family, but I wonder if I already knew my contemplation and lived in hiding. Nevertheless, what about that talent? People come by hearing the word of mouth. Parasitic lotus is one of them. It is an intention to try to make a lot of money by using the talent of inner diameter. They find themselves disguised as merchants, but they cannot fool the current contemplative.
The famous Seolmaejae area is a hidden silver grass spot.
“The light of the drawing turns and the lips with red lips are shameless. . ”
The autumn scenery on the way to the house of Naekyung at first glance resembles the red lips of the red. It is the Seolmaejae Passage, which is the foot of the famous mountain. It is named after plum blossoms bloom even when it snows a lot. Since 1999, a private recreational forest has been in operation on the ridge. It is well known to camping enthusiasts with its log cabin and auto camping site. Within the recreational forest, there were Damo Forest and Soseono Forest. Drama <Damo> and <Jumong> were filmed here.
Dark autumn leaves between the silver grass fields attract attention.
The filming location of <Contemplative> passes through the entrance to the Seolmaejae Recreation Forest and goes up a little further to the banner. When you reach the ridge, there are ATV rental stores and small container stores. There is a road towards the mountain next to the kiosk and there is a breaker. This is the head to the location. If you walk around 30 minutes by car, you can see the house of the inner diameter in <Contemplation>.
Sometimes a single autumn leaf is enough
Thatched house in silver grass field
At the entrance of Naekyung's house, the entrance of Imdo is overlooked by trees growing in laughter. Although the leaves of Ebisan sometimes appear, it is not satisfactory. Fortunately, the cool landscape opens as soon as we make up for the regret. On the left side of the road, Yongmunsan and Baekwoonbong boast great pride. It is a mountain that can feel autumn. Below that is the Namhan River stem. As if taking a breath, stop walking and look at you for a long time.
You and your house are covered with planks
When you turn back, it's a silver grass tingling. It is a sign that the house of the inner diameter is not far. Soon it is the first crossroads. There are signs on the three-way intersection, B, D course, and Wangnam course. It looks like a three-way street, but it is actually a crossroad. There is another side road behind the sign. If you take the Wangnam course, you can walk while enjoying the surrounding scenery. In particular, there was a tree in autumn with autumn leaves, and the sloping silver grass field and the surrounding mountains are impressive.
The house of the inner diameter of the movie <Contemplation>
If you walk a little further with that afterimage, you will see Samgeori. If you cross your head slightly uphill to the right, it is the back door of the house. In the movie, the path that Yeonhong was looking for is the left side road just behind the B and D course signs. I can see the silver grass field and the house of the inner diameter grows up on the hill.
A silver grass field beyond the back door seen from the thatched house floor
The house of Naekyung was built on the flat of the ridge. Two houses with ‘Yu-wa’ and ‘thatched’ have been placed as ‘ㄴ’. The bosom is the courtyard. In the scene where the inner diameter and Pangheon (Cho Jung-seok), who received money from Yeonhong, boiled a teeming chicken, are young. On one side, there is a small arch made of ocher like the trace. A silver grass rises along the ridge through the back door, and the autumn landscape spreads out through the front door. In the old days, it was used as a filming location for the drama <The Garden of the Winds>. This is where Kim Hong-do and Shin Yun-bok met. It has recently been used as a filming location for the drama <Goddess of Fire> after the movie <Contemplation>. Since modern civilization is not close, it is a good place to shoot historical dramas.
The mood of the autumn day is layering.
Ginkgo biloba silver grass, Yongmunsa temple
The area around Naekyung's house is a silver grass spot that attracts people, just like those who visited to see the contemplation. At one time, Hwa Jeon-min even worked the land. In the old days, there was also a dressage where horses were raised. The famous name of the famous mountain is Mayu Mountain. That is why humans are rare and secluded. It is worth taking a look at the surrounding scenery to enjoy the autumn mood.
Walking through the silver grass field leads to the famous mountain
You can take a little more steps. Paragliding active factories are not far from Limdo. In the active factory, you can see five pine trees matching the silver grass field, which is also a famous location. In the movie <The Man of the King>, Jangsaeng (Gam Woo-sung) and Gong-gil (Lee Jun-ki) played the final play. After the active factory, it leads to the top of Mt. Many people do not know the way to go to the silver grass field of <Kwannwan> because Mt.
Yongmunsan Tourist Complex
If you miss the autumn leaves than silver grass, it is better to turn your foot toward Yongmun Mountain than famous one. It takes about 30 minutes by car from Seolmaejae to Yongmunsan (it's too much to use public transportation). If there is silver grass in Seolmaejae, Yongmunsan is the autumn leaves. The best among them is the 1,100-year-old ginkgo tree of Yongmunsa Temple. As I foretell the fact, when I get close to the tourist attractions of Yongmunsan, ginkgo trees are greeted. Some still have a blue color, but the golden yellow color marks the peak of autumn. The road leading up to the entrance to Yongmunsan Mountain is perfect for a drive course.
Beautiful tulip trees in autumn
Ginkgo trees lined up from the parking lot of Yongmunsan to the entrance of the forest road. Ginkgo leaves fall off and a yellow road is like a fairy tale. A roadside ornamental man holds the passersby. As I passed the filming location of <Contemplative>, my heart moved. The foliage of vermilion tulip trees around the mall is also beautiful. It is one of the most coveted autumn leaves, but it is a relatively less known tree.
Road to Yongmunsan Tourist Complex
The 1,100 year old tree where the wind passes by
Walk up 1km along the forest path to Yongmunsa Temple. As the valley opens, red maple leaves appear instead of ginkgo trees. Yongmunsa Temple was founded in 2 years (913) by King Silla of Silla. It has nothing to do with the Suyangdae army in <Contemplation>. At the age of thirty (1447), he was ordered by King Sejong and first visited Yongmunsa to build a preservation for his mother, Queen Soheon, Sim. When he was forty years old three years after he was crowned the throne, he visited Yongmunsa Temple once more to replace the temple. The stricken distress (1453) to end the discontinuation was an incident in the meantime. It is the ginkgo tree of Yongmunsa Temple that I watched all day after day. Under the shade, the last line of the inner diameter in <Contemplation> comes to mind.
Yongmun Bridge with autumn leaves in harmony
“I only looked at the faces of people, not the times. … I need to see the wind ... It is the wind that makes the waves. You just rode high waves for a while. … Like the waves coming high break one day. ”
The color of the road to Yongmunsa Temple
Yongmunsa Ginkgo tree is said to have been planted on the way to Mt. Its history also matches the inner diameter. It is said that the costume ambassador's staff sprouted and became a ginkgo tree, and there is a legend that he made a sound whenever there was a big problem in the country. It is said that the Japanese army set fire to Yongmunsa Temple during the Korean War against the American Army (1907), but did not burn only ginkgo trees. You can tell by facing the ginkgo tree. It is not a tree that will be shaken by some interference. The wind is also dignified to pass. It's worth it as the leader reaches 1,100 years. It is about 42m high and the circumference of the base is 15.2m. It is the oldest and largest ginkgo tree in Korea. Even if you climb the stairs and face the Daeungjeon Hall, you cannot reach the height of the tree. So, Yongmunsa Temple is about 1,100 years ago.
Autumn mountain with foliage over Yongmunsa Yosachae
Autumn leaves are likely to be full on the second weekend of November this year. On the first weekend in November, the greenery was so dark that those who visited Yongmunsa temple devoured the regret. On the contrary, the autumn leaves of Yongmunsan will be more colorful. It culminated in late October through early November. If the normal person, Gaesupbong, is busy, a light hike from Yongmunsa Temple to Senate Temple is also not bad. If it's overwhelming, it's good to chew the words of Jinhyeong's son Jinhyung. He replied to the question of what was the most difficult thing to do after he stopped working in the past.
“It was not to resign from fate.”
It's about an hour or two of walking along a certain path.
1,100 years old ginkgo tree at Yongmunsa Temple
Travel information

Seolmaejae (House of Inner Diameter): 29-1, Yongcheon-ri, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do
Seolmaejae Recreation Forest : Mountain 29-21, Yongcheon-ri, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, 031-772-5965, www.snrf.co.kr
Longmen Temple: 625, Sinjeom-ri, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, 031-773-3797, www.yongmunsa.org

1.Access

* Self-driving

Seolmaejae (House of Inner Diameter): Jungbu Expressway Hanam IC → Paldang Bridge → Route 6 toward Yangpyeong → Goeup Intersection toward Cheongpyeong and Seorak → Baekhyeon Intersection → Seolmaejae Recreation Forest → Banner Mijae
Longmen Temple: Jungbu Expressway Hanam IC → Paldang Bridge → Route 6 toward Yangpyeong → Maryong Intersection → Yongmunsa Temple

* public transport

Seolmaejae (Naekyungui House): Take bus number 6-3 at Yangpyeong Terminal and get off at Yongcheon 3-ri Village Hall. Walk 5 km to Banner Mijae. Take a taxi from Yangpyeong Station (or Yangpyeong Terminal)
Longmen Temple: From Yongmun Terminal or Yongmun Station, take buses 7, 7-4, 7-8 and get off at Yongmunsa Temple

2. Restaurants around

Yongmunsan Farm Ssambap Village: Ssambap Set Meal, Ssamyuk Ssambap / 176 Yongmunsan-ro, Yongmun-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-771-8389
yard : Gondrebab / 239 Yongmunsan-ro, Yongmun-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-775-0311

http://www.foodup.co.kr/BzHome/?param=imuroo

Okcheon Sundubu: Sundubu / 124, Sinbok-gil, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-774-4369

3.Accommodation

Yongmunsa Temple Stay: 625, Sinjeom-ri, Yangpyeong-gun / 031-775-5797

www.yongmunsa.org
Seolmaejae Recreation Forest: amount

www.snrf.co.kr

http://www.yp-valley.co.kr/

item.title: Yangpyeong-gun, South Korea - Summer trip to sunflower village and rural train station
item.description:
Large signstone written `` Muwang 1-ri ''

Summer trip to sunflower village and rural train station

Yangpyeong-gun, South Korea

Many people are worried about where to go with their families on this summer's vacation. It is a good place for those who are looking for a place where they want to spend their time quietly rather than a place where a lot of people gather. It is the sunflower village of Yangpyeong-gun and Seokbul Station and Gudun Station, which are rural railway stations. Don't forget to take a camera with you to leave your family in a wonderful photo.
A village where you can see sunflowers faced to the sky
Sunflower Village, Seokbul Station and Gudun Station are located on Jipyeong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun. This area is famous for Jipyeong Makgeolli. You can get there by train, so you don't have to waste time during a busy holiday season. Not a lot of people come to visit, but it is perfect for a day trip quietly. If you set the date well, you can also enjoy the Yongmun oil market.
Sunflowers are on the road to the village
If you take a bus from the Yongmun Intercity Bus Terminal near Yongmun Station, you can get off at the bus stop where the large signpost written 'Muwang 1-ri' stands. 初 川 (chocheon) used together on the stone is the old name of the sunflower village. The water flowing through the Yeoju into the Namhan River began in the sunflower village and was called as follows. Pass through the stone and meet the typical rural village landscape. Sunflowers on the road seem to give the name of the village. The village boasts a peaceful landscape in the form of a basin at 300m above sea level.
A sunflower-themed mural was painted on the wall of the village.
The sunflowers that bloomed here were planted in late May and began to bloom in late July. In 2014, with the support of the Gyeonggi-do Agricultural Technology Center, sunflower seeds were planted for the income of the villagers. After the sunflower bloomed, the scenery began to spread. In the summer, photo club members often come to town to capture the flowers that fill the fields. Note that there are no restaurants or stalls in town.
Sunflowers began to bloom in late July
Sunflowers meet like a hidden picture
If you walk about 10 minutes from the stone, you will be able to park your car. This is the village entrance. Now it's time to find the sunflowers in full bloom and take a walk as you wish. In the villages, sunflower fields are not fixed, but they are planted using land, so you can find flowers everywhere. Sunflowers are also slightly bloomed, so you can go to flower viewing as if you are looking for a hidden picture.
Travelers taking commemorative photos with sunflowers in the background
In the middle of the road, the voices of those who look at the sunflowers and admire the beautifulness are often heard. There are many visitors who take commemorative photos standing side by side with sunflowers. Sunflowers are too tall or they turn their heads in the wrong direction, making them hard to see. It is also common here for children to marvel at the bees rushing toward a full-blown seed sunflower.
Bee rushing towards sunflower
If you want to know where sunflowers are spread throughout the village, you can refer to the guide map of `` Muwangri Sunflower Road '' installed on the crossroads before going to the town hall. In the parking lot, you can see a lot of sunflowers on the hill road, near the town hall, and on the way to the Muwang Church.
You can see the `` Muwang-ri Sunflower Road '' guide map at the crossroad
The village also held its 3rd Sunflower Festival 2016 (July 29-31). This is a village festival prepared for the flowering period of sunflowers. During the festival, visitors sold sunflower barley rice, yeolmu noodles, and pan-fried rice to visitors. There was also a marketplace selling sunflower seeds, barley, corn, potatoes, and bokbunja grown in the village. Sunflowers are expected to open until the end of August. The festival is over, but it's a good place to go to see flowers with your family.
Muwang-ri Town Hall
Seokbul Station is like a toy country
A simple station is a train station with few passengers. There is a station station where employees are in charge of their duties, but stop only trains without even having to. Thanks to the unique atmosphere and dignity, many people deliberately come to the station to feel romantic and memories.
There is a working room but no staff. To take the train towards Cheongnyangni, cross the underground passage to the right of the entrance. The distance from Sunflower Village to Seokbul Station is less than 3 km. If you drive by car, it's easy to get there, but it's not convenient to use public transportation.
Seokbul Station with red roof and blue exterior wall stands out from far away
Originally, Seokbul Station was destined to disappear due to fewer customers. It was unfortunate that the county and the county government jointly signed a campaign to prevent the removal of the Seokbul Station and built a new building in 2013. Thanks to this, there is no atmosphere of an old building that is expected of a simple station, but rather a small and small station building.
Many visitors take commemorative photos against the blue wall.
The pointed red roof of Seokbul Station and the outer wall of a blue building are easy to see from afar. Thanks to this, if you travel by bus or car from Yongmun or Muwang-ri, you can see the beautiful blue building in the distance. Standing in front of Seokbul Station building, it feels like a visit to Toy Land. The exterior walls and windows are a great backdrop for taking pictures. It's like a sketchbook with pastel colored walls.
Passage for downline train from Seokbul Station
Gudun Station, Memory of First Love on Hill
three
Climbing the hill leads to Gudun Station, a registered cultural property.
After passing Muwang-ri, cross the Ilshin 2nd Bridge and you will see a hill. If you go up the street, you will come to Ilsin Church. Since you have to walk the hill road based on Ilshin 2nd Bridge, if you are visiting this place in summer, it is recommended to climb slowly. Because the road is narrow, be careful when driving with you. There is space for parking in front of Gudun Station.
Long wooden chair staying inside the station
Complete your mission to the train station, and now you'll be able to walk through the tracks at the retired Gudun Station. Gudun Station is also famous as the filming location of the film Introduction to Architecture. Like the heroes in the movie, many people walk along the railway and leave memories on the camera. It's a great place to recall the fresh memories of your first love or to explain your old train station to your children.
Memo that the person who visited Gudun Station wished
Inside the station, there are long wooden chairs, train schedules and passenger fares. If you go out to the railroad tracks, you will see a wish tree with a memo of the people who visited this place. What did you write down? I peek at the short texts of strangers and write down my wishes and hang them by my side. Next to the tree stands a carriage that is not running. Take a walk with the whole family on a railroad train. About 100 meters of railroad tracks remain from the station building. The well-preserved closed area and the surrounding landscape are beautiful and it is a good place to spend some time.
Cars stopped at Gudun Station no longer run
Travel info

Sunflower Village
-Address: 113-1, Chocheon-gil, Jipyeong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do

Seokbul Station
-Address: 1319-2, Manmi-ri, Jipyeong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do

Gudun Station
-Address: 1336-9 Ilsin-ri, Jipyeong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do

Restaurants near
-Moonhori Red Bean Porridge: Red Bean Porridge, Red Bean Kalguksu / 641, Bukhangang-ro, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea / 031-774-5969

http://www.moonhori.com/
-Acorn Noodle Collection: Acorn Muktangguk / 99, Sinbok-gil, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do / 031-771-7562

http://031-771-7562.모바일114.kr/
-Yongmunsan Central Restaurant: The Deoksan Chaesiksik / 644 Yongmunsan-ro, Yongmun-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do, Korea / 031-773-3422

http://www.yongmunsan.co.kr/

Rooms
-Yangpyeong Hanok Village Ocher Pension: 43-6 Jeon 1-gil, Gangmyeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do / 031-773-6300
http://www.hanok54.co.kr/

-Breeze Pension: 49-2, Yanghyeon-gil, Okcheon-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do / 031-774-3429
http://www.pensionet.co.kr/

-Nest Pension: 325-16 Hwangsunwon-ro, Seojong-myeon, Yangpyeong-gun, Gyeonggi-do / 031-774-9178
http://www.dungji-yp.com/
